#Text=Jonny Gould
#Text=For the sports presenter , see Jonathan Gould ( presenter ) .
#Text=For the professional footballer , see Jonathan Gould .
#Text=Jonny Gould
#Text=is a British radio and TV presenter who broadcasts on Sky News on Sunrise and previously as a sports presenter at Smooth Radio and BBC Radio 2 .
#Text=Smooth Radio and BBC Radio 2
#Text=Gould presented breakfast show sport for Smooth Radio between 2012 and 2014 . [ 1 ]

#Text=After the Olympics , Smooth Radio then retained Gould to be reunited with breakfast presenter Simon Bates to present the morning sports news , more than 15 years after they first broadcast together on Talksport .
#Text=Gould joined BBC Radio 2 , deputising for Vassos Alexander as sports presenter on the Breakfast Show .
#Text=talkSPORT and talkRADIO
#Text=In addition to the weekday shows on Smooth Radio , Gould presented the weekend sports show Extra Time on Talksport [ 2 ]
#Text=He also presented the Sports Bar and Kickoff alongside Stan Collymore , Bobby Gould and Tony Cascarino .
#Text=Gould returned to working for the Wireless Group presenting the evening show on the newly launched DAB station talkRADIO .
#Text=He moved to late afternoon on Sundays from November 2016 . [ 3 ]
#Text=He left the station in July 2017 .
#Text=Sky News and ESPN
#Text=Since 2008
#Text=Gould has been a regular newspaper and sports pundit on Sky News providing comment and analysis .
#Text=From February 2014 , he became a regular contributor on Sunrise with Eamonn Holmes .
#Text=He also appeared on Between The Lines on ESPN with Ray Stubbs .
#Text=Al Jazeera
#Text=In 2010

#Text=Gould started to appear regularly on Al Jazeera English as a football expert to discuss a wide variety of football-related stories including the FIFA World Cup host country announcements for 2018 and 2022 and the many political controversies involving FIFA 's Sepp Blatter . [ 4 ]
#Text=ITV Sport
#Text=From 2000 to 2002 , Gould presented ITV Sport ' s Football First , a live four-hour football scores and reports show , and Euro Fever , a live studio show with an audience and guests .
#Text=He also presented ITV 's Goal Rush and was Premiership Plus first ever touchline reporter , covering the channel 's first eleven games . [ 5 ]
#Text=Channel 5
#Text=From 1997 to 2000 , Gould was the sports presenter on Channel 5 ( UK ) ' s morning news show 5 News with Katie Ledger .
#Text=IRN and LBC
#Text=Between 1992 and 1995
#Text=Gould provided sports news for Independent Radio News as Sports Editor and went on to become Associate Sports Editor in 1994 .
#Text=He also co-presented the Thursday Night Sports Phone-In with Robbie Vincent between 1990 and 1994 .
#Text=BBC World Service
#Text=From 1990 to 1993 , Gould presented BBC World Service " Sports Roundup " and " Sports World " , the BBC 's flagship Saturday afternoon programme .

column1: #Text=Sportsmedia
#Text=Gould is CEO of Sportsmedia , which provided over 150 national and local radio stations and social media with daily sports content .
#Text=The company was started in 1992 and client stations included Global Radio and Jazz FM .
#Text=The bulletin service closed after 24 years of service , although the business continues to produce video content and activate sponsorships via radio features , podcasts and online .
#Text=Corporate clients included Sky Sports , Capital One and Northern Rail [ 6 ]
#Text=Other

#Text=Gould is also an ambassador for Action Duchenne [ 7 ] a national charity supporting people living with Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy and Striker Boy , a mental health awareness campaign with the charity , MIND .
